newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Ayala to infuse more capital, issue debt.
newsitem.headline: Ayala to infuse more capital, issue debt.

text.p: Ayala Land Inc said on Wednesday its board had approved the sale of 4.0 billion to 6.0 billion pesos worth of long-term commercial paper.
The proposed debt issue has been registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

Ayala said in a statement the board had also approved an additional equity infusion of 140 million pesos in Pilipinas Makro, a wholesale trading company, to bring its total investments to 310.24 million pesos.
Ayala Land said its additional equity in Pilipinas Makro would help fund the acquisition and site development of a third store in Metro Manila. Ayala Land holds a 28 percent stake in Pilipinas Makro.

Renato Marzan, the company's assistant corporate secretary, said the planned long-term commercial paper issue would be Ayala Land's second offering following a successful 3.0 billion peso issue in December 1994.
"At today's prices, this instrument gives converting paper holders a remarkable return of over 45 percent per year, on top of a guaranteed return on capital," he said.
The latest issue is convertible into Ayala Land Class B shares with a par value of one peso.
The issue will have a term of five years and the offer price will be at par. The company will secure shareholders' written consent on the issue of conversion shares.
